chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Benjamin J Cooper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Benjamin J Cooper was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Benjamin J Cooper was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Benjamin J Cooper was found guilty of Child Enticement-Cause Mental/BodilyHarm, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(5).
  • Benjamin J Cooper was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.   Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: $518  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

Sex Offender Registry Required for 10 yrs F/W.   Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-prev provided per DCSO.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KEG, MFT, GCG and GEM or their family. No unsupervised contact with females under 18 without prior written approval of agent. Def banned from all Targets in Dane County. Def not to be at West Towne Mall.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED. Concur to ct 4.   To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).

miscConds.notes: $243  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 4.

Sentencing hearing on September 8, 2017 at 01:45 pm.-NOT HANDED OUT ON 6-5-17 IN COURT - MAILED
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.

Defendant in court with Attorney Kim Marie Zion.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed prior to hearing today. Defense rec'd copy of amended information and waives reading of information.   Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed.  Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 2,3,4, & 5.  Count 1 dismissed.  Court accepted def's plea, found and adjudged defn guilty. State agrees to cap argument at a no prison recommendation.  DDA Satter requests a PSI w/o sentence recommendation be done. Ct. orders that if convicted of ct. 4 defn. will be required to comply with WI sex offender registry. Ct. orders PSI be done w/o sentence recommendation. Bail continued.
